message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is about developing a Chinese wordnet using machine learning and manual correction. It involves natural language processing, which falls under the category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The use of machine learning also suggests that it could be categorized under artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). The experiments conducted in the paper involve relatedness calculation, word similarity, and word sense disambiguation, which are tasks commonly associated with information retrieval (cs.IR) and natural language processing (cs.CL). Lastly, the paper's focus on improving accuracy and coverage suggests that it could also be categorized under neural networks (cs.NE).
